de.larssh.utils.net

Class GlobalProxyConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.larssh.utils.net.GlobalProxyConfiguration

  • public class GlobalProxyConfiguration
extends Object
    Proxy related properties, described at Network Properties.

    Usage example 1: The following shows how to set a global HTTP proxy. 

     InetSocketAddress inetSocketAddress = new InetSocketAddress("proxy.example.com", "8080");
 GlobalProxyConfiguration.HTTP.setGlobalProxy(inetSocketAddress);

    Usage example 2: The following shows how to unset the global HTTP proxy. 

     GlobalProxyConfiguration.HTTP.unsetGlobalProxy();

    • Field Detail

      • FTP

        public static final GlobalProxyConfiguration FTP
        FTP proxy related settings

      • HTTP

        public static final GlobalProxyConfiguration HTTP
        HTTP proxy related settings

      • HTTPS

        public static final GlobalProxyConfiguration HTTPS
        HTTPS proxy related settings

        The HTTPS protocol handler will use the same nonProxyHosts property as the HTTP protocol. Use HTTP to modify that property.

      • SOCKS

        public static final GlobalProxyConfiguration SOCKS
        SOCKS proxy related properties

        The SOCKS protocol handler does not support the nonProxyHosts property.

    • Method Detail

      • addNonProxyHosts

        public void addNonProxyHosts(String... nonProxyHosts)
        Appends all of nonProxyHosts to the current protocols nonProxyHosts property if it is not already present.

        For protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        nonProxyHosts - any number of hosts that should be accessed without going through the proxy
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - for protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property

      • getNonProxyHosts

        public Set<String> getNonProxyHosts()
        Returns all patterns of the current protocols nonProxyHosts property.

        For protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        Returns:
        patterns of the current protocols nonProxyHosts property
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - for protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property

      • getNonProxyHostsPropertyOrThrow

        protected String getNonProxyHostsPropertyOrThrow()
        Returns the current protocols nonProxyHosts property name.

        For protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the current protocols nonProxyHosts property name
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - for protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property

      • removeNonProxyHosts

        public void removeNonProxyHosts(String... nonProxyHosts)
        Removes all given patterns from the current protocols nonProxyHosts property.

        For protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        nonProxyHosts - any number of hosts that should not be accessed with going through the proxy
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - for protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property

      • resetNonProxyHosts

        public void resetNonProxyHosts()
        Resets the current protocols nonProxyHosts property.

        For protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        Afterwards nothing but the default nonProxyHosts are set.

        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - for protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property

      • setGlobalProxy

        public void setGlobalProxy(InetSocketAddress inetSocketAddress)
        Overwrites the JVM global current protocols proxy properties with the given host and port.
        Parameters:
        inetSocketAddress - host and port to apply globally

      • setNonProxyHosts

        public void setNonProxyHosts(Collection<String> nonProxyHosts)
        Overwrites the current protocols nonProxyHosts property with the given patterns.

        For protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        nonProxyHosts - any number of hosts that should be accessed without going through the proxy
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - for protocols not supporting the nonProxyHosts property

      • unsetGlobalProxy

        public void unsetGlobalProxy()
        Overwrites the JVM global current protocols proxy properties.
